sections.title: Prevention
sections.introduction: One of HEAL's primary initiatives is to prevent Opioid Use Disorder by bringing awareness to the community. Below are links to other groups working to prevent OUD.

cards.title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
cards.content: A resource with information about reducing exposure to opioids and preventing opioid use disorder.

cards.title: Health and Human Services (HHS)
cards.content: A list of links to prevention programs and tools

cards.title: U.S. Department of Education
cards.content: Information regarding the ways in which the opioid crisis is being addressed in public schools.

sections.title: Treatment
sections.introduction: Another major goal for HEAL is to improve and increase the treatment options available for patients with Opioid Use Disorder. Below are several links to resources that might help you learn more about the treatment options currently available.

cards.title: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Service Administration (SAMHSA)
cards.content: A confidential and anonymous source of information for persons seeking treatment facilities for substance abuse.

cards.title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
cards.content: A resource ensuring the best information is being shared and understood to prevent overdose deaths.

cards.title: Food and Drug Administration (FDA)
cards.content: A resource providing information about current treatments and the development of new therapies.

cards.title: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)
cards.content: A description of the Opioid Treatment Programs (OTPs) covered by Medicare and Medicaid.

sections.title: Support
sections.introduction: HEAL is sponsoring several studies focused on improving the support system for those affected by Opioid Use Disorder. Below are links to government resources that may be helpful to anyone looking for general support.

cards.title: Health and Human Services (HHS)
cards.content: General information, including the national helpline and a link to the NSDUH Annual National Report.

cards.title: Health Resources & Service Administration
cards.content: Information about the Opioid-Impacted Family Support Program and eligibility criteria.

cards.title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
cards.content: A variety of helpful guides and information pages with the goal of supporting patients and clinicians.

cards.title: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)
cards.content: Links to the SUPPORT act and supporting information about this legislation.

cards.title: National Institute on Aging (NIA)
cards.content: Information and resources regarding acute and chronic pain.

cards.title: U.S. Department of Veteran Affairs
cards.content: Information and resources regarding pain in the veteran population.

cards.title: HEALing Communities Across America
cards.content: Communities and scientists join forces to save lives from opioid use disorder.
